moves.1... c5 2. e4: decided on building up my centre
moves.2... d5 3. exd5: i thought for while but couldn't see a better move
moves.3... Qxd5 4. Nc3 Qd8: massive head start on development, i have two knights out and he has nothing
moves.5. d4 e6 6. dxc5: went in for the queen exchange
moves.7... Bd7 8. Bg5 Nf6 9. Bxf6 gxf6: that wrecked up pawn structure helped me later
moves.10... Nxd7 11. Qd2: trying to castle my rook behind my queen
moves.11... Qb6 12. Rf1: that move was a bad mistake
my attack had ran out of steam and i was stuck
moves.16. Rd3: i needed to protect the knight and the loss of the c pawn was inevitable if i wanted to save the knight
moves.18. Qxb7: trying to claw back some material
moves.18... Re8 19. Qc7 Be7: the counter attack seemed dead but this set up won the game
moves.26... Qxc3+ 27. Qxc3 Bxc3 28. Rgf3: doubling my rooks was point where i knew i had hope
moves.30... Bxh2 31. Ra4: the unluckily (for my opponent) positioned pawns meant that there was no chance of me getting checked
moves.31... Kg7: the straw that breaks the camels back
moves.32... Kh6 33. Rh1: pinning the bishop and winning the game
moves.33... Kh5 34. Rg3 Kh4 35. Rg7: a beautiful position and the point my opponent resigned unable to save himself
